intro: Ruellia quaterna, commonly known as four-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia quaterna is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
